issues.description: The UML diagram in the problem statement marks addAnimal(Animal) with a '-' (private) visibility, while the textual description and example usage expect it to be callable from outside (e.g., Main calls farm.addAnimal(goat)). The solution implements addAnimal as public. This visibility inconsistency in the UML may confuse students about whether addAnimal should be public (so they can add animals from Main) or private (which would prevent the shown example and intended usage).
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify and align the visibility: update the UML in the problem statement to mark addAnimal(Animal) as public (use '+' instead of '-') so it matches the textual description and example usage. Alternatively, explicitly state in the text that addAnimal should be public. Ensure the template exposes a public addAnimal(Animal a) signature so students are not confused about its accessibility.
